result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-12-2022

Defendant Antonio Walter Roberts appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Antonio Walter Roberts.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Walter Roberts in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Antonio Walter Roberts.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 8-19-22

Defendant Antonio Walter Roberts in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Imposed and stayed bench warrant is cancelled. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: St Francis Police Officer Platt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant having trouble loggin into video. Court ordered an imposed and stayed bench warrant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for Return on warrant. Court cancels the warrant and reinstates bail/bond and conditions of bail. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

22RM017722  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03-31-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Antonio Walter Roberts in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Antonio Walter Roberts in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Walter Roberts appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
